comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Contaminated monochrome image of Douglas A-1H Skyraider in USAF Southeast Asia (SEA) camouflage scheme of Tan (FS30219), Dark Green (FS34079), and Medium Green (FS34102) over Light Gray (FS36622) undersides. White tail code AD of 4407 Combat Crew Training Squadron And letter number combination AF 52 243 below. Its full former Bureau of the Navy serial 135243 fits within AD-6/A-1H serial batches. Becoming 52-135243 with the USAF. When in USAF service this was altered to suit Air Force taste to become AF 32 243. 4407 Combat Crew Training Squadron was based at Hurlburt Field, Eglin Air Force Base, Florida and trained all USAF Skyraider pilots. A July 1971 4407th CCTS A-1 Skyraider inventory includes A-1H 135 243: skyraider.org/hook/skytail.htm#anchor470101 4407th CCTS picture webpage: www.skyraider.org/skyassn/otherpics/mignard/4407ccts/4407... The Douglas Skyraider originally served with the US Navy from the 1950s and flew off aircraft carriers both in peace time and combat during the Vietnam War. After retirement from the US Navy many single and dual seat A-1 Skyraiders were acquired by the US Air Force, for service mainly in South East Asia. Then refurbished and modified with pneumatic tail wheels, tailhooks removed, new radio and navigation gear plus a YANKEE seat extraction unit installed. A-1H 135243 is recorded as being transferred to the air force of the then Republic of South Vietnam (VNAF). From approximately 290 Skyraider of all types supplied to the VNAF, at least three quarters were lost, and most of those remaining were captured by the then North Vietnamese when South Vietnam was invaded and over run between 1973 & 1975.

comment.author: 26233414@N00
comment._content: Flew this A-1 H on 9/1/71 during my training program at Hurlburt Field in preparation for my combat tour with the 1st SOS from Oct 71 to Oct 72. Read about it at Skyraider.org
